issue.title: Mac OS X 10.11.1 compilation error: libevent not found.
issue.body:
I brew installed libevent, got the error at ./configure

 checking for EVENT... no
configure: error: libevent not found.

In my /usr/local/lib/, I have libevent_openssl and etc, but NOT libevent_dev, 
so I brew uninstall it and manually install libevent, still not found libevent_dev.  

Can anyone give me some suggestions?  Thanks.

issue.title: Cannot generate libsecp256k1.so in macOS Sierra (10.12.5)
issue.body:
Following the instructions in https://github.com/Christewart/bitcoin-s-core/blob/master/BUILD_README.md in macOS Sierra led to the following error in `config.log`:
```
conftest.c:11:10: fatal error: 'ac_nonexistent.h' file not found
#include <ac_nonexistent.h>
```

Notice that before this error occurred, running `./autogen.sh` led to an error which was apparently fixed by running the command, `brew install automake`.

Running the make step does not generate the expected file, `secp256k1/.libs/libsecp256k1.so`.

issue.title: configure: error: libevent not found. on macOS High Sierra 10.13.1
issue.body:
Hi there

I met the problem after running
```python
./configure
```
according to the https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/build-osx.md

I have tried other solutions like https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/7269
and used 
```python
brew uninstall libevent
sudo port install libevent
```
to uninstall libevent from brew and reinstall it using port, but it dosen't work.

Is it a problem of macOS version?
